intro: Minuartia favargeri, commonly known as the favargeri rockcress, is a low-growing perennial plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit and small, bright green leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white wax. The plant produces clusters of tiny, four-petaled white or pale yellow flowers during the spring and early summer. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is typically found in alpine or subalpine environments. Minuartia favargeri is adapted to harsh conditions, making it a resilient species in mountainous regions.
